ClassHelp.paragraph: The basic data display grid allows you to access any record in a file.

Click on the Lookup button to select a record.
Click on the Form button to display this record as a
Form ?help=&screen=Screen Form
.
Click on the Delete button to remove a record.

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: These are functions for typical toolbar buttons.
ClassInfo.ClassHelp:
Icon Function Keyboard
Shortcut		 Menu
Function		 Description
  Next Field Tab
Enter
Down Arrow		   Move the cursor to the next field
  Previous Field Shift+Tab
Up Arrow		   Move the cursor to the previous field

Cut Ctrl+Delete
Ctrl+X		 Edit
Cut		 Delete the currently selected text and place it on the clipboard.
Copy Ctrl+C
Ctrl+Insert		 Edit
Copy		 Copy the currently selected text and place it on the clipboard.
Paste Shift+Insert
Ctrl+V		 Edit
Paste		  Paste the text on the clipboard to the current cursor location or selection.
Lookup     Change this form to lookup mode to search for a record.
For Fields, bring up the lookup grid for this file.
Print Ctrl+P File
Print		 Print this screen.
First Record   Record
First Record		 Display the first record.
Next Record Ctrl+Down Arrow Record
Next Record		 Display the next record.
Previous Record Ctrl+Up Arrow Record
Previous Record		 Display the previous record.
Last Record   Record
Last Record		 Display the last record.
New Record Ctrl+Enter
Ctrl+(+)		 Record
New Record		 Display a new blank record.
Reset Form Esc+Esc Record
Refresh Record		 Undo all the changes on this record and redisplay the old data.
Delete Record Ctrl+Delete
Ctrl+(-)		 Record
Delete Record		 Delete this record.
Help F1 Help
Help		 Access the help information for this screen.
Context Sensitive Help     Access the help information for this item.
E-Mail     Bring up the e-mail screen with this address.
Fax     Bring up the fax screen with this fax address.
Form     Bring up the data-entry form for this file.
Grid     Bring up the data-display grid for this file.
Home     Go to the home page.
Mail     Bring up the mail screen for this address.
Phone     Dial this phone number (must have a JTAPI-enabled computer).
Undo Ctrl+Z
Esc		 Edit
Undo		 Undo the last editing operation.
URL     Bring up the browser and go to this URL.
  Hard Return Shift+Enter   Enter a carriage return in a text box
  Close Window Ctrl+W File
Close		 Close the current window
  Preferences   Edit
Preferences		 Open the screen preferences window

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: This is a base record class that contains the status for a value. The possible status values are: 0 - NULL_STATUS - Status field is null 1 - NO_STATUS - Status is unknown 2 - LOOKUP_REQUIRED 3 - LOOKUP_SCHEDULED 4 - VALID - Info valid 5 - NOT_VALID
ClassInfo.ClassExplain:
The possible status values are: 1 - NO_STATUS - Status is unknown 2 - LOOKUP_REQUIRED 3 - LOOKUP_SCHEDULED 4 - VALID - Info valid 5 - NOT_VALID 6 - LOOKUP_ERROR The typical status lifecycle works as follows: A status field is initialized to: NO_STATUS. When any field changes that may affect the status, status is changed to: NOT_VALID. When the status changes to NOT_VALID, the record is analyzed. If there is not enough info for a lookup, the status stays NOT_VALID. If there is enough info, the status is changed to: LOOKUP_SCHEDULED and a lookup is queued. When the lookup returns information, If valid information was returned/set, the status is changed to: VALID. If the information is not valid, the status is changed to: LOOKUP_ERROR
LOOKUP_REQUIRED is a placeholder. If you are asked for a lookup and the record has not been written yet, this is set and on AFTER_whatever the LOOKUP_REQUIRED can be changed to LOOKUP_SCHEDULED.
The base class for message processing tasks.

ClassInfo.ClassDesc: This is the base class for screen views
Base screen view for HTML views

This is the base class to process an external message. This class handles two distinct but related functions:

- It converts an incomming external message and processes i

ClassHelp.paragraph: The application message detail screen is used to specify the transport and any message specific properties.

Each entry specifies a message, the transport you are describing, whether this is the default transport for this message, and any number of properties for this message/transport pair. This screen is used to specify the transport properties for each message and overrides for specific vendors and products.
There is a hierarchy of message properties.
Application specific message properties are used in:

item-list.item: Profile control Profile control ?record=ProfileControl Form - Default transports for specific messages sent to/from profiles.
Profile Profile ?record=Profile Form - Transports and properties for a specific profile contact (Overrides Profile Control).
Accounts Payable Control Accounts Payable Control ?record=ApControl Form - Default transports for specific messages sent to/from Vendors.
Product Product ?record=Product Form - Transport for specific products (Hotel, Cruises, etc). Overrides Vendor Transports.
Vendor Vendor ?record=Vendor Form - Transports and properties for a specific vendor contact (Overrides Accounts Payable Control).

ClassHelp.paragraph: This file describes the methods of transporting messages.
For each transport type, enter a:

item-list.item: Description
Code
Properties for this transport (formatted as key=property)
Transport type

ClassHelp.paragraph: The transport type specifies the general type of message:

item-list.item: Direct - This message is sent internally within the system (Such as a hotel rate that was entered manually)
Local - This message is sent to the internal system's external port (For example a hotel's tour package would book the hotel using the local SOAP connector)
Remote automated response - Computer to computer connections (response is automatic) (ie., SOAP, etc)
Remote manual response - Automated message requiring human response (ie., EMail, Fax, etc.)
Client - Same as Direct, but the Message is processed in a separate user thread.
Server - Same as Direct, but the Message is processed in a server thread.
Manual - Manually sent message requiring human response (ie., Phone call). The Message Status record=BaseMessageStatus Help must be changed manually also.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The properties that must be entered are specific to the type of transport:
EMail Transport requires the following properties:

item-list.item: host - The name of the smtp (outgoing) email server
replyTo - The default reply to email address to place in outgoing email
subject - The default subject line of outgoing email (typically not specified since most email has a subject specified in the message info)
sendUsing - The type of incoming email server (pop3 or imap)
pop3host - The name of pop3 (incoming) email server
pop3username - The username for the pop3 server
pop3password - The password for the pop3 server
inbox - The name of the inbox to check (typically not specified - system will retrieve from "INBOX")
interval - Amount to time the system will wait (in milliseconds) before checking the mail again (If not specified, default interval is 1 minute [6000 ms])

ClassHelp.paragraph:
Any of these properties can be overidden in the
Message Process record=MessageProcess Help or
Message Information record=MessageInfo Help screens.
The type of contact a message is send to.

Message Information record=MessageInfo Help file.
Note: These codes are usually not modified by the user.
The message information file contains the system information on each type of message.
A message is for a specific message, such as a Hotel Pricing Request Message or a Hotel Pricing Response Message.
The message information includes:

item-list.item: A description
An (optional) code
The internal java class that encapsulates this message (derived from the BasePhysicalMessage class) (This class has methods to convert data from internal representation to general message data).
Properties - Message specific properties
Message type
The companion response message
The type of contact this message is sent to/from.
The general type of message

ClassInfo.ClassExplain: Information or update message process type.

ClassHelp.paragraph:
The type of message in the
Message Information record=MessageInfo Help file.
The current message types are:

item-list.item: Information Message - This message is just used to request or return information (ie., Hotel Room Availability)
Update Message - This message updates some infomation (ie., Hotel Room Booking).

ClassHelp.paragraph: Note: This file usually will not change.
The message process is the code that coverts the message from internal representation to a general message or back.
The important field required for a Message Process are:

item-list.item: The description
The message process code (Typically this is the SOAP message code)
The reply message processor
The message type
The process type
The class of the java code to do the message processing.
Properties - Specific to this message processing

ClassHelp.paragraph:
Since a specific message can be received on any number of transports, you can click the
Transport detail record=MessageTransportInfo Detail button to display the transport specific records.
The process message transport detail information gives the process and transport tasks specific information for processing this message.
Enter a transport type, and enter the specific properties for this message. The properties vary by transport type:
The E-Mail specific message properties are:

item-list.item: subject - The subject line for an email message.
XSLTDocument - The file to use to convert the XML to a human-readable document.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The SOAP specific message properties are:

item-list.item: JAXBPackage - The JAXB message class package name
externalMessageClass - The JAXB message class to use to process the message

ClassHelp.paragraph: The HTML specific message properties are:

item-list.item: formReply - The form to use on an HTML screen.
emailReply - The form to use on an EMail screen.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The Screen specific message properties are:

item-list.item: screen - The java class of the screen to display.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The Local specific message properties are:

item-list.item: messageInCode - The Message process code of the incomming message.

ClassHelp.paragraph: The message information file contains the system information on each type of message.

ClassHelp.paragraph: A user security group is a group that posseses security priviledges.
For example, Administrators, res agents, and outside vendors would be different security groups.

Click on the
Detail ?record=UserPermission Detail
button to view the user group's resource permissions.

Click on the
User Detail ?record=UserInfo Detail
button to view the users in the selected group
A System resource is a resource that is accessible by a certain group of users.
For example, The Accounting system or the Reservations system would be accessible to users with the correct privileges.

Click on the
Detail ?record=UserPermission Detail
button to view the resource's user group permissions.
This file maps user permissions to resources.
